metrics: Track org-level KPIs: time-to-resolution (IT), content cycle time, policy exceptions, % tasks automated.
Adoption metric: % of target roles using approved AI tools weekly (active users / eligible users).
Risk metric: # of shadow-AI incidents per week and mean time to containment.
posts.takeaway: Focus on 2–3 processes where AI can remove toil quickly. Pair enablement with clear guardrails to convert usage into impact.

posts.subject: Weekly: Inside Organizations, AI Becomes the Default (but Governance Lags)
posts.intro: A fast read on how companies are weaving AI into day‑to‑day operations — what changed this week, where value shows up, and what to watch.

items.headline: Workers accept AI as a teammate, balk at an AI boss
items.summary: New survey reporting high comfort collaborating with AI but far less appetite for AI ‘managers’ underscores the need for human‑in‑the‑loop design.

items.headline: Carlyle’s playbook: 90%+ employee AI use after structured rollout
items.summary: Private equity giant details councils, training, and workflow picks—cutting research cycles from weeks to hours while preserving human oversight.

items.headline: Execs push: ‘Use AI daily—or risk falling behind’
items.summary: Leadership pressure grows as firms formalize expectations for AI‑augmented work; culture and enablement decide whether this helps or harms.

items.headline: AI takes aim at IT busywork
items.summary: Vendors roll out automation for ticket handling, device lifecycle and incident summaries—early adopters report quicker MTTR and lower toil.

items.headline: Shadow AI swells—governance must catch up
items.summary: Unauthorized tool use is widespread; companies respond with policies, audits, and secure approved stacks to reduce leakage and compliance risk.

metrics: McKinsey (2025): ~78% of orgs use AI in at least one function; ~71% use gen‑AI somewhere.
Work Trend Index (2025): ~29% of leaders save ≥1 hour/day with AI; workforce split on ‘tool vs. partner’.
Private AI investment (2024): ~$250B+ total, continuing to rise into 2025 (various indices).
posts.takeaway: Impact tracks workflow redesign, not tool count. Formalize governance, train for new ‘AI teammate’ norms, and measure time‑to‑value on a few high‑leverage processes first.
